Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a plant with adequate water and light to show it growing well, including healthy green leaves and proper structure.
The student can draw a plant without water and light and show it not growing well, using wilted leaves and possibly brown or dull colors to indicate poor health.
The student can include visual details in their drawing, such as differences in leaf color and structure, that accurately represent environmental conditions.
The student can depict scenes with clear labels or arrows to show that plants need water and light to live and grow, using symbols like suns and raindrops.
The student can use color coding or symbols consistently to distinguish between healthy and unhealthy plants, reflecting differences in growth conditions.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit a label or arrow, but this is likely an oversight rather than a misunderstanding.
The student might not always perfectly align all visual elements, but these do not significantly detract from overall accuracy.
